bill.title: Residential Landlord-Tenant Code; Medical Marijuana; Eviction; Rental Agreement; Voided Provisions
bill.description: Voids any rental agreement provision that allows for eviction of a tenant who has a valid certificate for the medical use of marijuana unless: (1) the rental agreement allows for eviction for smoking tobacco and the medical marijuana is smoked; or (2) the documents of a condominium property regime or planned community association prohibit the medical use of marijuana. Effective 11/01/2014. (SD1)

history.action: Prefiled
Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to CPC/JUD, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC/JUD on Wednesday, 02-19-14 2:15PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Kawakami, Brower, Creagan, Evans, C. Lee, Nakashima, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Cachola, Har, Oshiro, Tsuji, Yamane; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Ito; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, McDermott.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Brower, Creagan, Kawakami, C. Lee, Nakashima, Wooley, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Har, Tsuji; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Ito; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, McDermott.
Reported from CPC/JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 669-14) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1; placed on the calendar for Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Woodson excused (2).

Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Aquino, Cullen, Fale, Fukumoto, Har, Ito, Johanson, Matsumoto, Oshiro, Tokioka, Tsuji voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Wooley excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 214).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPN, JDL.
The committee(s) on CPN has scheduled a public hearing on 03-11-14 9:30AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPN were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Taniguchi, Nishihara, Wakai; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Slom.
Reported from CPN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2852) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-28-14 10:00AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in JDL were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Galuteria; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Ihara, Solomon, Slom.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3327) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading.
One Day Notice 04-08-14.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading. Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Slom . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 518) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 676).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-10-14.
Senate Conferees Appointed: Baker Chair; Hee Co-Chair; Slom Member.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 682).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).

Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with Representative(s) Har, Tokioka, Tsuji voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Fale, Fukumoto, Ito, Matsumoto voting no (4) and Representative(s) Ing, Oshiro excused (2).
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 673).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 688).
Transmitted to Governor.
